item.title: About Me
item.description: I am a 2020 graduate of Northeastern University, with a combined major in Electrical and Computer Engineering. Since graduating, I have been working as an electrical engineer with Lockheed Martin’s Advanced Energy Storage division in Andover, MA, which is currently focused on the Gridstar Flow line of solutions. In my free time I am an avid bicycle tourist, amateur bicycle mechanic, and all-around tinkerer. You can find me assembling guitars, practicing the saxophone, or 3D printing when I have the chance.

item.title: Great Allegheny Passage / C&O Canal Tour 2021
On the topic of getting started
item.description: Welcome Please bear with me as I get the site all set up. “There is much pleasure to be gained from useless knowledge.” - Bertrand Russell

item.title: Wireless Audio Control Interface - WACI
item.description: This project was designed and assembled at Northeastern University in the fall of 2019 for my team’s EECE senior capstone design project. Included here is the abstract and associated project materials. Thanks to group members Joshua Berlin, Jess Bardio, Matan Silver, Phil Del Signore, and Lousia Beckwith as well as our advisor, Professor Bahram Shafai. UPDATE - WACI featured in the IEEE-HKN Bridge publication The Wireless Audio Control Interface won the IEEE Eta Kappa Nu honor society’s 2020 Senior Poster competition.

item.title: themecredit
item.description: This website is a personal homepage. The site is built with Hugoâ€”a static site generator made with Go. The website source code is available on GitHub. It uses the cocoa theme. The posts are written in Markdown. The primary font face is Open Sans and the monospace font face is Ubuntu Mono. The social icons are from the Ionicons font set. CSS classes for code syntax highlighting are inserted during compile-time by Hugo using Pygments.
